messages.title: Our United Kingdom – Standing Free and Proud
messages.content: For our children and grandchildren's sake we must take back control of our nation's destiny.

messages.title: Local hero Captain Flinders coming home to Lincolnshire
messages.content: As soon as news reached that the remains of Captain Flinders had been discovered in London, I knew battling to bring him home to Lincolnshire was the right thing to do.

messages.title: John's Service and Success Recognised
messages.content: Sir John Hayes awarded an Honorary Doctorate for his 'outstanding service to education'.

mentions.candidate: Sir John Hayes awarded an Honorary Doctorate for his 'outstanding service to education'.

issues.brexitEurope: The British people's decision in the referendum to leave the EU was both a transformative and straightforward truth--those at home must have the power to determine our nation's destiny.
issues.government: Respecting the referendum and honouring the resultant means leaving the EU--no ifs, no buts.

community.content: As soon as news reached that the remains of Captain Flinders had been discovered in London, I knew battling to bring him home to Lincolnshire was the right thing to do.

leaflet.personalStatement: Having campaigned ever since the 1970s for our great to nation to be free from supranational, bureaucratic interference from Europe, I am determined to see this through to the end.

politicalExperience.achievements: Securing the return of Captain Flinders' remains to Lincolnshire.

endorsements.endorsement: Sir John Hayes awarded an Honorary Doctorate for his 'outstanding service to education'.

quotes.text: We as a family are very grateful that you took the trouble and time from your busy schedule to read our 17-page long document which some of it wasn't exactly light reading, you also did exactly as requested.
I have watched you over many years spreading your magic, yes it is magic John. Just keep doing it, please. The Country needs your magic.

Thank you so much for your excellent and knowledgeable contribution to the debate on the serious subject. You have worked very hard for a while now and you’ve become an asset to this place where you once edited for a newspaper.

examples: Respecting the referendum and honouring the resultant means leaving the EU--no ifs, no buts.
Having campaigned ever since the 1970s for our great to nation to be free from supranational, bureaucratic interference from Europe, I am determined to see this through to the end.
As soon as news reached that the remains of Captain Flinders had been discovered in London, I knew battling to bring him home to Lincolnshire was the right thing to do.

We as a family are very grateful that you took the trouble and time from your busy schedule to read our 17-page long document which some of it wasn't exactly light reading, you also did exactly as requested.
Sir John Hayes awarded an Honorary Doctorate for his 'outstanding service to education'.
I have watched you over many years spreading your magic, yes it is magic John. Just keep doing it, please. The Country needs your magic.
As soon as news reached that the remains of Captain Flinders had been discovered in London, I knew battling to bring him home to Lincolnshire was the right thing to do.

We as a family are very grateful that you took the trouble and time from your busy schedule to read our 17-page long document which some of it wasn't exactly light reading, you also did exactly as requested.
Having campaigned ever since the 1970s for our great to nation to be free from supranational, bureaucratic interference from Europe, I am determined to see this through to the end.
The British people's decision in the referendum to leave the EU was both a transformative and straightforward truth--those at home must have the power to determine our nation's destiny.
Respecting the referendum and honouring the resultant means leaving the EU--no ifs, no buts.
